Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.execution

Class BaseResourceResolver

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.execution.BaseResourceResolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceResolver
Direct Known Subclasses:
SingleResourceResolver
public abstract class BaseResourceResolver extends Object implements ResourceResolver
Base implementation of the ResourceResolver interface that provides common functionality for resolving FHIR resources during FHIRPath evaluation.

This abstract class implements core resource resolution methods and provides a foundation for more specialized resource resolvers. It handles:

  • Basic resource resolution by type code
  • Subject resource resolution
  • Resource creation with appropriate column representations

Subclasses must implement:

  • getSubjectResource() - to define the primary resource type
  • getFhirContext() - to provide the FHIR context for resource definitions

By default, this implementation does not support joins or reverse joins, and subclasses must override the relevant methods to provide that functionality.

  • Method Details

    • getSubjectResource

      @Nonnull public abstract Enumerations.ResourceType getSubjectResource()
      Returns the subject resource type for this resolver.

      The subject resource is the primary resource type being queried, such as Patient in a query starting with Patient.name.given.

      Returns:
      The subject resource type

    • getFhirContext

      @Nonnull public abstract FhirContext getFhirContext()
      Returns the FHIR context used by this resolver.

      The FHIR context provides access to resource definitions and other FHIR-specific information needed for resource resolution.

      Returns:
      The FHIR context

    • resolveResource

      @Nonnull public Optional<ResourceCollection> resolveResource(@Nonnull String resourceCode)
      Resolves a resource by its type code.

      This method is used to access resources by their type name, such as "Patient" or "Observation".

      This implementation first checks if the requested resource code matches the subject resource. If it does, it returns the subject resource. We don't support resolving resources other than the subject resource in this implementation.

      Specified by:
      resolveResource in interface ResourceResolver
      Parameters:
      resourceCode - The FHIR resource type code (e.g., "Patient", "Observation")
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the ResourceCollection if the resource type exists, or empty if it doesn't

    • resolveSubjectResource

      @Nonnull public ResourceCollection resolveSubjectResource()
      Resolves the subject resource for this context.

      The subject resource is the primary resource type being queried, such as Patient in a query starting with Patient.name.given.

      This implementation creates a resource collection for the subject resource type.

      Specified by:
      resolveSubjectResource in interface ResourceResolver
      Returns:
      A ResourceCollection representing the subject resource

    • createResource

      @Nonnull protected ResourceCollection createResource(@Nonnull Enumerations.ResourceType resourceType)
      Creates a ResourceCollection for the specified resource type.

      This method creates a column representation for the resource and builds a ResourceCollection using the FHIR context and resource type. The column representation uses the resource type code as the column name.

      Parameters:
      resourceType - The resource type to create a collection for
      Returns:
      A ResourceCollection for the specified resource type

    • createView

      @Nonnull public Dataset<Row> createView()
      Creates the underlying dataset view for query execution.

      This method returns the Spark Dataset that contains the data for the subject resource and any joined resources. It's used as the starting point for evaluating FHIRPath expressions.

      The base implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException. Subclasses that support view creation must override this method.

      Specified by:
      createView in interface ResourceResolver
      Returns:
      A Spark Dataset containing the view data

    • getResourceDataset

      @Nonnull protected static Dataset<Row> getResourceDataset(@Nonnull DataSource dataSource, @Nonnull Enumerations.ResourceType resourceType)
      Creates a dataset for a specific resource type with a standardized structure.

      This method:

      1. Reads the resource data from the data source
      2. Checks if the resource type exists (throws an exception if not)
      3. Restructures the dataset in a standardized structure.

      This standardized structure is used throughout the resource resolution process.

      Parameters:
      dataSource - The data source to read from
      resourceType - The resource type to read
      Returns:
      A dataset containing the resource data in a standardized structure
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the resource type is not found in the data source

    • toResourceRepresentation

      protected static Dataset<Row> toResourceRepresentation(@Nonnull String resourceCode, @Nonnull Dataset<Row> resourceDataset)
      Creates a dataset for a specific resource type with a standardized structure.

      This method restructures the dataset to have:

      • An "id" column for the resource ID
      • A "key" column containing the versioned ID for joining
      • A column named after the resource type containing all resource data as a struct

      This standardized structure is used throughout the resource resolution process.

      Parameters:
      resourceCode - The resource type to read
      resourceDataset - The dataset containing the flat resource data
      Returns:
      A dataset containing the resource data in a standardized structure
